title: Senior Director - Client Data Analytics at ACADIA Pharmaceuticals in Princeton, NJ

description:
The scope of responsibility is broad and includes supporting our largest business units on topics ranging from service KPI optimization, client experience, client retention analytics, pricing strategy, and service technology. To conduct this work, you will partner closely with a dynamic and highly matrixed team comprised of data architects, engineers, scientists, visualization experts. You will make extensive use of tables, charts, graphics, and slides based on your own and the collective body of research conducted by the team. Based on this research and results, you will communicate key points to business stakeholders along with recommended actions for increased business impact and advance our analytics maturation. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values:
Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills Prior experience in consulting, data science, analytics, product management, client experience or related fields, with preference for candidates who have deep understanding in any of the following domains:
contact center operations, contact center technology, pricing, risk, and financial analysis. Demonstrated ability to drive innovation through analytics; using findings from analysis to support creation of business case and implementation of those recommendations in highly matrixed team environment to deliver measurable business impact. Expert proficiency translating complex analytic findings, interpretation, and recommendations into content suitable to drive decision making by executive audiences. This includes effective use of slides, charts, tables to facilitate the decision making and call to action. Experience working with structured, semi-structured and time-series data to identify patterns Ability to operate with a continuous improvement mindset, building impact incrementally. Ability to successfully navigate complexity, ambiguity, and pressure to get things done in a fast-paced environment that requires balancing competing priorities. Ability to work in a highly collaborative manner with a reasonable degree of independence Exceptional communication, partnership, and collaboration skills Ability to effectively manage time to handle competing high priority projects Individual contributor, working in highly matrixed and collaborative team environment, with people management potential after onboarding to ADP and department. Required:
10
years of experience working in a large client-focused organization. Bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative or technical field preferred. Evening and weekends as needed based on project deliverables.
Salary Range:
$100K -- $150K
Minimum Qualification
Organization Development & Training, HR Generalists & Business PartnersEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
